member.name: T:ZintNet.BitVector
member.summary: Class for storing and retreving bit data.
member.author: satorux@google.com (Satoru Takabayashi) - creator
dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin) - ported from C++
www.Redivivus.in (suraj.supekar@redivivus.in) - Ported from ZXING Java Source
Milton Neal milton200954@gmail.com Ported to C# and added additional methods for manipulating bit data.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.ToByteArray
member.summary: Gets a copy of the vector as a byte array.
member.returns: a copy of the vector array

member.summary: Gets the size of the vector in bits.

member.summary: Gets the size of the vector in bytes.

member.summary: Get the current capacity of the vector.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of BitVector class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of BitVector class of a given size.
member.param: size in bytes of the vector

member.summary: Returns the bit value at a specified bit index.
member.param: index to the bit to be returned

member.summary: Sets the bit at a specified bit index.
member.param: index at which to set the bit

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.Insert(System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Inserts a bit into the vector.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.RemoveBits(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: index within the vector to remove the bit

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.AppendBit(System.Byte)
member.summary: Appends one bit to the vector.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.AppendBits(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
/// Appends bits to the vector.
- appendBits(0x00, 1) adds 0. - appendBits(0x00, 4) adds 0000. - appendBits(0xff, 8) adds 11111111.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the bit vector and resets it's size to 0.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.AppendBitVector(ZintNet.BitVector)
member.summary: Appends the contents of a bit vector to the current vector.
member.param: the bit vector to be appended

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.Xor(ZintNet.BitVector)
member.summary: Modify the bit vector by XOR'ing with another vector.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.ToString
member.summary: Builds a string representation of the bit vector.

member.name: M:ZintNet.BitVector.AppendByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Appends a byte to the end of the vector.
member.param: the byte value to be added

member.summary: Encodes the composite symbol data into a binary bit stream.

member.summary: Test if AI[90] data compression can be used.

member.summary: Encodes the compressed part of AI[90] field into the binary bit stream.

member.summary: Process the rest of the AI[90] field.

member.summary: Adds the required padding to the binary bit stream.

member.summary: Adjusts the binary data and add padding.
member.param: number of bits in the codeword

member.name: M:ZintNet.Encoders.CodaBlockEncoder.CreateCharacterSetTable(System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{ZintNet.Encoders.CharacterSetTable},System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a table for each data charater.
member.remarks: int CharacterSet: is and or of CodeA,CodeB,CodeC,CodeFNC1, in dependency which character set is applicable. (Result of GetPossibleCharacterSet) int AFollowing, BFollowing: The number of source characters you still may encode in this character set. int CFollowing: The number of characters encodable in CodeC if we start here.

member.name: M:ZintNet.Encoders.CodaBlockEncoder.GetPossibleCharacterSet(System.Byte)
member.summary: Find the possible Code-128 Character sets for a character.
member.remarks: The result is an or of CodeA, CodeB, CodeC, CodeFNC1 in dependency of the possible Code 128 character sets.

member.name: M:ZintNet.Encoders.Code128Encoder.GroupBlocks(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Brings together the same size block.

members.member: Translate Code 128 Set B characters into barcodes. This set handles all characters which are not part of long numbers and not control characters.

member.summary: Check that the message format conforms with the HIBC stardard.
member.returns: character array holding the formated message

member.summary: Checks for valid characters and the correct formation of the AI's.

member.name: M:ZintNet.MessagePreProcessor.TildeParser(System.String)
member.summary: Parse the barcode message and process any 'tilde' values.
member.remarks: Takes the message string and copies it to the barcode character array, processing any 'tilde' values. 1 digit decimal values ~@ to ~' Or 3 digit decimal values from ~000 to ~255 Suitable for symbols that accept values 0 to 255

member.summary: Returns the message as a character array without any preprocessing or checks.

member.summary: Passes an input message of numeric values only.
